intro: Armeria alpina var. elatior, commonly known as the alpine thrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often used in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
